publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1100 Elaine Thomson: World Corporate Games, July 2000-That the Parliament notes Aberdeen's success in attracting the 13th annual World Corporate Games, in terms of health by encouraging the "Fit for Work, Fit for Life" ethos amongst employees and by promoting the profile and economy of the North East; further notes that the 10,000 competitors are expected to contribute approximately £6 million to the local economy, and hopes that the competitors, who originate from up to 40 different countries around the world, return to visit this beautiful city and area.
S1M-1100 World Corporate Games, July 2000 (lodged on 7 July 2000) Shona Robison*

S1M-1100 Elaine Thomson: World Corporate Games, July 2000-That the Parliament notes Aberdeen's success in attracting the 13th annual World Corporate Games, in terms of health by encouraging the "Fit for Work, Fit for Life" ethos amongst employees and by promoting the profile and economy of the North East; further notes that the 10,000 competitors are expected to contribute approximately £6 million to the local economy, and hopes that the competitors, who originate from up to 40 different countries around the world, return to visit this beautiful city and area. Supported by: Shona Robison
